parsetree.*:
<root>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Unit Control </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Set the current task of the formation member. <template><title>arma2-obsolete</title></template> </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> object '''setFormationTask''' task </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> object: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> task: [[String]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[formationTask]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on 16:57, 2 March 2007 (CET)
<dt class="note>'''[[User:Donnervogel|Donnervogel]]'''<dd class="note">The argument for ''task'' can be any String value. This can effectively be used to store a property in String format an retrieve it with [[formationTask]] in FSM scripts. By using it outside of FSM scripts you're risking to get it overwritten by other running FSM scripts.
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
